definition: horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: After a year of not being H.'s girlfriend, K. was accepted into the University of Malaya.
sentences.chinese: 与H分手一年后，K收到了马来亚大学的通知书。

sentences.english: Payment via Maybank and Public Bank only.
sentences.chinese: 只限付款在马来亚和大众银行。

sentences.english: Since then contact were lost and severed with Malaya because of the World War.
sentences.chinese: 因为世界大战爆发，所以他们与马来亚就失去了联系。

sentences.english: Dr. Lee Poh Ping is a Senior Research Fellow in the Institute of China Studies, University of Malaya.
sentences.chinese: 李宝平博士为马来亚大学中国研究中心的高级研究员。

sentences.english: Rubber became the staple of the Malayan economy.
sentences.chinese: 橡胶成了马来亚经济的支柱产品。

sentences.english: TT to a Maybank account in Brunei, Malaysia, or the Philippines.
sentences.chinese: 特向在文莱，马来西亚，菲律宾或马来亚银行帐户。

sentences.english: In parts of Malaya, the women keep harems of men.
sentences.chinese: 马来亚的部分地区，女人男妾成群。

definition: Borneo island (of Indonesia, Malaysia and Brunei)
variant of 蘇門答臘|苏门答腊[Su1 men2 da2 la4]
Sarawak, state of Malaysia in northwest Borneo 婆羅洲|婆罗洲
Sumatra, one of the Indonesian islands
Indochina (old term, esp. colonial period)/now written 中南半島|中南半岛[Zhong1 nan2 Ban4 dao3]
pinyin: Yin4 du4 zhi1 na4 Ban4 dao3
Ba1 bu4 ya4 Xin1 Ji3 nei4 ya4
